intro: Physaria rosei subsp. rosei, commonly known as the rose spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by elongated seed pods. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
